bill.title: Relating To The Workers' Compensation Law.
bill.description: Amends the title of chapter 386, part V, subpart C, HRS, to add reserve public safety law enforcement officers, and amends section 386-181, HRS, to include reserve public safety law enforcement officers to the list of volunteer occupations covered under the workers' compensation law. Allows reserve public safety law enforcement officers who are injured under the conditions specified in section 386-3, HRS, to receive workers' compensation. Adds reserve public safety law enforcement officers to the list of volunteers who are covered under the conditions for computing average weekly wages. (CD1)

history.action: Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to LCA/PSM, WAM/JDC.
The committee(s) on LCA/PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-14-22 3:00PM; Conference Room 225 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Baker, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) DeCoite, Riviere.

The committee(s) on LCA recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in LCA were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Taniguchi, Ihara, Chang, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Keohokalole.
Reported from LCA/PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2400) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to WAM/JDC.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM/JDC.
The committee(s) on WAM/JDC will hold a public decision making on 03-02-22 9:30AM; Conference Room 211 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDC were as follows: 7 Aye(s): Senator(s) Rhoads, Keohokalole, Acasio, Gabbard, Kim, Lee, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 11 Aye(s): Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Keith-Agaran, Inouye, Kanuha, Kidani, Misalucha, Moriwaki, Shimabukuro, Taniguchi, Wakai, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from WAM/JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3185) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 03-08-22.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Fevella). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 452) in amended form (SD 1).
Pass First Reading
Referred to LAT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 24
Bill scheduled to be heard by LAT on Tuesday, 03-15-22 9:30AM in House conference room 312 Via Videoconference.

The committees on LAT recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Onishi, Sayama, Belatti, Holt, D. Kobayashi, Takayama, Okimoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Quinlan.
Reported from LAT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1042-22), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Tuesday, 03-22-22 2:00PM in House conference room 329 Via Videoconference.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 9 Ayes: Representative(s) Johanson, Kitagawa, Aquino, Har, Kong, Morikawa, Onishi, Tarnas, Matsumoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Hashem, Mizuno.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1432-22) as amended in HD 1, recommending referral to FIN.
Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ohno excused (1).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 04-06-22 2:45PM in House conference room 308 Via Videoconference.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Yamashita, Branco, Eli, Holt, Ilagan, B. Kobayashi, Marten, Nishimoto, Perruso, Sayama, Tam, Todd, Wildberger; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) McDermott.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1853-22), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey, Quinlan excused (2). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 566).
Senate disagrees with House amendments.
Received notice of disagreement (Sen. Com. No. 866).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Taniguchi Chair; DeCoite, Shimabukuro, Keohokalole Co-Chairs; Fevella.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 880).
House Conferees Appointed: Onishi, Johanson, Sayama Co-Chairs; Okimoto.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 729).
Conference committee meeting scheduled for 04-22-22 10:40AM; Conference Room 224.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Taniguchi, DeCoite, Shimabukuro; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Keohokalole, Fevella.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 4 Ayes: Representative(s) Onishi, Johanson, Sayama, Okimoto; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 113-22).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 05-03-22.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 113-22) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday 05-03-22.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 0 Excused: none.
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 946).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 824).
Enrolled to Governor.
